intro: Parosela scoparia f. arsenei, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in racemes. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
